events.title: Publication of Newton's Principia Mathematica
events.description: Isaac Newton publishes his landmark work, Philosophiae Naturalis Principia Mathematica, laying the foundations of classical mechanics.
events.significance: This work formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation, revolutionizing physics and astronomy.

events.title: Philippine Independence from the United States
events.description: The Philippines gains full independence from the United States, ending nearly 50 years of American colonial rule.
events.significance: Marked the establishment of the Republic of the Philippines and a significant post-colonial transition in Southeast Asia.

events.title: The Treaty of Saint Petersburg Signed
events.description: Russia cedes Alaska to the United States in a treaty signed in Saint Petersburg, Russia.
events.significance: Set the stage for future American expansion into the Pacific Northwest and eventual purchase of Alaska from Russia.

events.title: The Battle of Okinawa Ends
events.description: The Battle of Okinawa, one of the bloodiest battles in the Pacific Theater during World War II, concludes with Allied victory.
events.significance: This battle was pivotal in bringing Allied forces closer to Japan, influencing the decision to use atomic bombs.

events.title: Iliou Melathron, the Archaeological Museum of Thessaloniki, Opens
events.description: This museum opens to the public, showcasing significant artifacts from Macedonia and Thrace.
events.significance: Provides cultural preservation and insight into the history and heritage of the Greek region.
